title: 15k-Mile 1987 Porsche 911 Turbo Coupe
description: This 1987 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe was registered in New Jersey and Pennsylvania before it was offered on BaT in April 2021, and it now shows 15k miles. Finished in black over matching leather upholstery, the car is powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six linked with a four-speed manual transaxle and an optional limited-slip differential. Additional equipment includes a rear spoiler, 16″ Fuchs wheels, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, fog lights, a sunroof, air conditioning, a Blaupunkt cassette stereo, and height-adjustable front sport seats. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this 930 Turbo coupe is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer's literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 15k-Mile 1987 Porsche 911 Turbo Coupe at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #186,510.
text: This 1987 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe was registered in New Jersey and Pennsylvania before it was offered on BaT in April 2021, and it now shows 15k miles. Finished in black over matching leather upholstery, the car is powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six linked with a four-speed manual transaxle and an optional limited-slip differential. Additional equipment includes a rear spoiler, 16″ Fuchs wheels, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, fog lights, a sunroof, air conditioning, a Blaupunkt cassette stereo, and height-adjustable front sport seats. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this 930 Turbo coupe is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title. The body is finished in black and features a power-operated sunroof along with front and rear spoilers. Additional equipment includes a rear window wiper, headlight washers, and front fog lights. The image above and the majority of the photos in the listing gallery were taken in May 2024. Staggered-width 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero Rosso tires measuring 205/55 front and 245/45 rear. Braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated discs. The height-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black leather and are complemented by a color-coordinated center console, door panels, and carpeting. Amenities include air conditioning, an analog clock, power windows, and a Blaupunkt cassette stereo that was repaired in 2019. The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,700-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, fuel level, and boost pressure. The six-digit odometer shows 15k miles, a handful of which were added under current ownership. The turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 278 lb-ft of torque. The selling dealer tells us that work in January 2024 consisted of cleaning the fuel system, rebuilding the warm-up regulator and fuel distributor, and replacing the fuel filter and accumulator along with assorted seals. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transaxle and an optional limited-slip differential. The window sticker lists initial delivery to Paul Miller Porsche of Parsippany, New Jersey, along with colors, equipment, options, and a total of $63,795. Manufacturer’s literature and service records will accompany the car. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other reported damage. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. html:
This 1987 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe was registered in New Jersey and Pennsylvania before it was offered on BaT in April 2021, and it now shows 15k miles. Finished in black over matching leather upholstery, the car is powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six linked with a four-speed manual transaxle and an optional limited-slip differential. Additional equipment includes a rear spoiler, 16″ Fuchs wheels, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, fog lights, a sunroof, air conditioning, a Blaupunkt cassette stereo, and height-adjustable front sport seats. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this 930 Turbo coupe is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The body is finished in black and features a power-operated sunroof along with front and rear spoilers. Additional equipment includes a rear window wiper, headlight washers, and front fog lights. The image above and the majority of the photos in the listing gallery were taken in May 2024.

Staggered-width 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero Rosso tires measuring 205/55 front and 245/45 rear. Braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated discs.

The height-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black leather and are complemented by a color-coordinated center console, door panels, and carpeting. Amenities include air conditioning, an analog clock, power windows, and a Blaupunkt cassette stereo that was repaired in 2019.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,700-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, fuel level, and boost pressure. The six-digit odometer shows 15k miles, a handful of which were added under current ownership.

The turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 278 lb-ft of torque. The selling dealer tells us that work in January 2024 consisted of cleaning the fuel system, rebuilding the warm-up regulator and fuel distributor, and replacing the fuel filter and accumulator along with assorted seals.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transaxle and an optional limited-slip differential.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to Paul Miller Porsche of Parsippany, New Jersey, along with colors, equipment, options, and a total of $63,795. Manufacturer’s literature and service records will accompany the car.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other reported damage.
